title: How to Change Trackpad Sensitivity on a Mac

steps.title: Click the Apple icon.
steps.content: Click the Apple icon. It's the Apple logo on the left side of the menu bar at the top of your screen.

steps.title: Click System Preferences.
steps.content: Click System Preferences . [1] X Expert Source Stan Kats Cybersecurity Expert Expert Interview. 27 October 2021.

steps.title: Click the "Trackpad" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Trackpad" icon. [2] X Expert Source Stan Kats Cybersecurity Expert Expert Interview. 27 October 2021. If you can't see the main menu, click the three rows of dots at the top left corner of the window, which displays as Show All in earlier versions of Mac OS X.

steps.title: Click on the "Tracking Speed" bar's cursor.
steps.content: Click on the "Tracking Speed" bar's cursor. It's the little white notch. [3] X Expert Source Stan Kats Cybersecurity Expert Expert Interview. 27 October 2021.

steps.title: Drag the cursor back and forth.
steps.content: Drag the cursor back and forth. Doing so will increase or decrease how quickly your cursor moves across the screen while using your trackpad.

steps.title: Click the Apple icon.
steps.content: Click the Apple icon. It's the Apple logo at the top left corner of the menu bar.

steps.title: Click the "Accessibility" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Accessibility" icon. It's the blue circle with a person inside it. If you can't see the main menu, click the three rows of dots at the top left corner of the window, which displays as Show All in earlier versions of Mac OS X.

steps.title: Click Mouse & Trackpad on the list on the left.
steps.content: Click Mouse & Trackpad on the list on the left.

steps.title: Click Trackpad Options at the bottom of the window.
steps.content: Click Trackpad Options at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click on the "Scrolling speed" bar's cursor.
steps.content: Click on the "Scrolling speed" bar's cursor. It's the little white notch.

steps.title: Drag the cursor back and forth.
steps.content: Drag the cursor back and forth. Doing so will increase or decrease how fast your scrolling motion is while using your trackpad. Click the drop down menu next to "Scrolling" to choose to scroll with or without inertia. When you scroll quickly with inertia turned on, the scroll bar will continue to move for a moment after you've stopped scrolling.

steps.title: Click the red "X" button.
steps.content: Click the red "X" button. Your trackpad changes will be saved!
